page.title: 19LEISURE TIME IN 1985
page.content: We spend our leisure time in energetic pursuits, such as roller skating and swimming, or we spend it quietly, watching television and playing card and board games. Two popular board games are Monopoly and Scrabble. Monopoly uses a large board with the names of London Streets around its sides. Each player takes turns in moving around the board, buying streets. If another player lands on a street you have bought, he has to pay rent. The object of the game is to get as much money as possible. Scrabble uses a board covered by small squares. Each player has 7 letters which are used to make up a word. Points are given for each word, more points being given for longer words. The object of the game is to gain more points than anyone else.
